instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no boot/chime
threads.message: I have an 3437 that actually has a spinning fan but no chime / display. Saw some corrosion under the JTAG and removed it. There is a hole in the board under pin 5 <SIGNAL>LPC_AD</SIGNAL>, could this be the issue or is this not important for booting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no boot/chime
threads.message: LPC is certainly needed, so probably a short in the board :(
